channel.description: Recent content in Quest of Dungeons on David Amador

item.title: Quest of Dungeons Switch Physical Release
item.description: First of all, Happy Birthday to Quest of Dungeons 7th anniversary, initially released on March 25th 2014 for PC and iOS. QoD eventually got several other versions and big content updates over time, and that‚Äôs all thanks to the support of the fans, making it possible for me to continue working on it, so thank you. One thing I got asked frequently was about a physical release, and it took a bit of time but I‚Äôm happy to announce that, in cooperation with Leoful, it‚Äôs finally happening, and soon too, release date is April 13 and pre-orders are live (begin tomorrow, March 26).

item.title: Quest of Dungeons is coming to Nintendo Switch
item.description: EDIT (09/09/2017): Europe and America are now scheduled for a September 14 release date. Hey, So this will be a quick post, as news started appearing on twitter a couple moments ago and I wanted to answer some questions. Super happy to say that Quest of Dungeons is coming to Nintendo Switch. Every since Nintendo announced the console that I‚Äôve been getting questions so this will make a lot of people happy, and the best thing is that it‚Äôs not far away.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons turns 3 years old, a small message for the community
item.description: Exactly 3 years ago today, March 25th, Quest of Dungeons was released on Steam and iOS. Feels unreal thinking what happened in these past three years, for those who remember I wasn‚Äôt even sure the game could make it to Steam, let alone end up being accepted by PlayStation, Nintendo and Xbox for their consoles. A couple of days ago I was thinking I should do something special for today, but instead of discounts or promotions I decided to write a couple of words to you, the community.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons is out now on PlayStation 4
item.description: It‚Äôs here, it finally happened! Quest of Dungeons is finally out for PlayStation 4 üòÄ PS4 dashboard showing question of dungeons First of all, here are the links for the respective stores, you can also just search for the game and it should show on PSN Store. item.title: Some thoughts about a 4 year game dev cycle
item.description: As I‚Äôm starting to write this post I‚Äôm on my way to my home town for the holidays, so I may not post it in a couple days. It‚Äôs been a crazy year(s)(?) and I‚Äôm taking these near 4h of travel to write down some things. I‚Äôm sorry if it‚Äôs incoherent, this is mostly a dump of thoughts. For those who follow my work a bit more closely you probably know that for almost 4 years the project I dedicated more time was Quest of Dungeons, which started development in 2013.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons is coming to PlayStation 4
item.description: EDIT: Release date will be January 17th 2017! Exciting news, Quest of Dungeons is on it‚Äôs way to PlayStation 4!! It‚Äôs actually been in development for some time, and it‚Äôs very near completion, so it‚Äôs not going to be a huge wait until release hopefully. The official QoD page on PlayStation went live just now so I decided it was a good time to let you know that this is happening, since I‚Äôve been getting questions about a PS4 version for some time.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons also coming to Nintendo 3DS on September 29
item.description: I have great news. Quest of Dungeons is coming to Nintendo 3DS on September 29. A couple weeks ago I announced that QoD was being released for Wii U on September 29 but I didn‚Äôt had a specific release date for the Nintendo 3DS version. I spent the last few weeks trying to sort all know issues on the Nintendo 3DS version and I‚Äôve been working with Nintendo to see if it can be released at the same time as the Wii U version.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons coming to Wii U on September 29
item.description: Hey, I have some good news, I just got confirmation of the final release date for Quest of Dungeons on Wii U, it‚Äôs coming on September 29, both Europe and America. So we are nearly there, ‚Äúhype.jpg‚Äù. Quest of Dungeons Wii U F.A.Q. -Does it have off-TV support? Yes, you can play with the GamePad only. -Does it support Wii U Pro Controller? item.title: QoD 3DS/Wii U port devlog 1
item.description: So how are the Nintendo ports coming along? It‚Äôs been sometime since I announced Quest of Dungeons for 3DS and Wii U, so it‚Äôs time to talk about what‚Äôs been happening in the ‚Äúbackstage‚Äù. I‚Äôm working on both versions at the same time, potentially for a simultaneous release. But this adds some extra challenges since both are very different and well, I‚Äôm juggling between two ports on my own.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons is coming to Nintendo 3DS and Wii U
item.description: Nintendo fans rejoice!!! It‚Äôs time to reveal what I‚Äôve been up to lately, I‚Äôve been very cryptic on Twitter about what I was actually doing but it was for a good cause, because Quest of Dungeons is making it‚Äôs way on to Nintendo 3DS and Wii U. Development started a couple months ago, so I still don‚Äôt have an ETA, but from now on I can be less vague to what I‚Äôm really doing.

item.title: year review log 2015
item.description: Can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs almost new year again. It became a habit of mine to to hit pause for a couple minutes, look back, write about it and think about what‚Äôs next, this helps me to sort things out. Thank you I have to start with something, a big Thank You for all the people who purchased QoD, everyone who helped spreading the word, the ones who wrote emails, tweeted and help my solo developer work became an even better thing to do.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons reviews roundup
item.description: Hi everyone, Quest of Dungeons was released on Xbox One exactly a month ago, and the response has been very positive from both players and reviewers, so I decided to list a couple review links here. There are several more, and tons of Youtube videos, so thank you all for helping spreading the word. 9/10 ‚Äì Xbox Tavern 8.1/10 ‚Äì Sticky Trigger 8/10 ‚Äì What‚Äôs Your Tag 8/10 ‚Äì ICMX

item.title: My first ever console game is out
item.description: Hey, it‚Äôs been a while. For the past few months I‚Äôve been working on porting Quest of Dungeons to Xbox One, and I‚Äôm super happy that it‚Äôs finally out. It was released around a week ago, on September 4. This took some time but I‚Äôm happy of the way the game is played with a gamepad, after a lot of changes to the UI I really feel like it was worth all the effort I put into it.

item.title: Make your own QoD Xbox One controller
item.description: A lot of you asked me how they could have their Xbox One controller to look like this So today I‚Äôm sharing the template that you can use to print your own controller üòÄ Start by downloading this image: (Right click, open in new tab, Hi-res download) For my own controller I used a website called decalGirl, but use whatever similar service you prefer or a local store if you have it.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons is now available on Xbox One
item.description: It‚Äôs alive!!!! Quest of Dungeons finally landed on the Xbox One, and it‚Äôs available to buy right NOW!! Xbox Store link: https://store.xbox.com/en-US/Xbox-One/Games/Quest-of-Dungeons/c5fc3166-ea13-4a23-becb-9e52ed638652

item.title: Quest of Dungeons coming to Xbox One on September 4
item.description: Hey everyone! You know that thing you‚Äôve been asking me these past few weeks? I finally have a release day. I‚Äôm very pleased to announce that Quest of Dungeons is coming to Xbox One on September 4th via the ID@Xbox self-publishing program. After months of development I‚Äôm very excited to finally be able say that it will be available on your console on that day. Quest of Dungeons is a turn based roguelike game, featuring that good old 16-bit art style we grew up with.

item.title: Let's talk about the new stuff in Quest of Dungeons for Xbox One
item.description: I‚Äôve been talking about some of the new stuff here and then, but it‚Äôs time to show the Xbox version in more detail. A lot of the UI was remade to allow proper gamepad support, several bugs and tweaks were made, and even new features. Lets take a closer look. In game First of all, here‚Äôs how it looks in game, a very minimalist UI if I might say so.

item.title: Necrodancer is joining
item.description: Hi! I‚Äôve been keeping this one a secret, but there‚Äôs going to a be a new class, a Necrodancer. Yes you guessed it, it‚Äôs an homage to Cadence from the awesome game Crypt of the Necrodancer, you should buy it btw! I‚Äôve been thinking about adding a new class for some time but never quite found anything interesting, each character, in my mind has it‚Äôs own personality and charisma and I was having a hard time finding any other interesting class.

item.title: QoD 1 year anniversary
item.description: Quest of Dungeons is one year old, which means the first release was on March 25th 2014. I decided to leave you with some interesting stats collected over the whole year, it only counts Steam players , so it‚Äôs probably a bit more.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons GDC 2015 Trailer for the Xbox One
item.description: Hey everyone, just a small update. GDC 2015 is happening right now and last night a trailer was released for Quest of Dungeons running on the Xbox One. I made all new footage, running at 1080p in 60FPS for this new trailer, but kept more or less the structure of the original one since I think it reflects well what the game is all about.

item.title: QoD XO devlog 3
item.description: Last time we talked I was porting the engine to run on the actual Xbox One hardware, since them I managed to port the whole engine, it‚Äôs now running (not 100% stable), sound, rending, and input, all working. Since that part is a bit better now I decided to focus some time on new content, such as localization, the new dungeons and stuff that still doesn‚Äôt properly work with a controller.

item.title: QoD XO devlog 2
item.description: I‚Äôve been tweaking a lot of the gameplay to be suitable to use with a game controller and I‚Äôm starting to like the way it‚Äôs headed, it‚Äôs much more streamlined, faster and easy to use than the first attempt I made, some beta testing with a group of people helped with that. Last week I started porting the engine to DirectX, yeah it‚Äôs that fun moment where nothing works, crashes everywhere.

item.title: QoD iOS and Android update 1.1.1 released
item.description: A new patch for iOS and Android went live, v1.1.1 There are some differences in what‚Äôs new for each one of the platforms, the biggest change being support for iPhone 6 and 6 Plus on iOS and x86 architecture support on Android. The reason why there are more tweaks on the iOS is because the Android version was updated more recently. After this update they are on par on features and fixes.

item.title: QoD XO devlog 1
item.description: I‚Äôve been doing a lot of menus and gamepad specifics related work lately. My first step has been to make sure all menus are easy to use with a Xbox One controller, and while most of the menus in the main screen are usable, inside the game they are not. Everything was made with mouse in mind at first so I decided to remake all of them again in a different way.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons is coming to Xbox One
item.description: I‚Äôm very happy to announce that Quest of Dungeons is coming to Xbox One. The game was released for the first time on Steam in March 25th and the response has been super positive so I‚Äôm excited to bring QoD to new players in a ‚Äúhome console‚Äù. I‚Äôll be handling the port myself, because that‚Äôs what a one man team means üôÇ I will keep you in the loop to what‚Äôs happening in the backstage so keep tuned‚Ä¶

item.title: EGX 2014
item.description: I had the chance of going to EGX in London this year with Quest of Dungeons. The whole show lasted 4 days and it was AMAZING, met tons of players, and a lot of developers. Everyone was super friendly, so I had a lot of fun. This was the first time I did something like this, so it was a very good way to get feedback and talk in person with players and even some fans of the game.

item.title: Indie Dev & Day Job, Making it work / Building Quest of Dungeons
item.description: During Gamedev Camp 2014 in Lisbon I got to talk a bit about the development of Quest of Dungeons, and some of the problems that I had making it while still having a day job. Most indie developers don‚Äôt have enough money to work on their game full-time so they have to keep a day job in order to support it, so this is a bit of my own personal experience doing it, some of the problems that came with it and mistakes I did during the development and launch of the game.

item.title: Native game on Android & Porting Quest of Dungeons
item.description: Quest of Dungeons was made in C++ and OpenGL, it runs on Windows, Mac and Linux in native code. iOS is not a problem either since I just have a thin layer of Objective-C to access some functionality like touch, accelerometer, etc and the rest of the code just runs. I never made anything for Android, in fact I never even used one before this, so when I decided to port QoD to it, I had no idea of what to expect.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons is now available
item.description: I‚Äôm pleased to announce that Quest of Dungeons is finally out. I didn‚Äôt get to make a post on day one, and it‚Äôs been nearly two weeks since launch but these past 2 weeks have been one crazy roller coaster. It was released on March 25th, for PC, Mac and iOS. You can get it on Steam, iOS App Store or directly from the site via Humble Store. I released all platforms on the same day, which was something I always wanted to try, and I have to say that it didn‚Äôt went as bad as I thought.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons approved on Steam
item.description: A lot of stuff happened since my last post. I launched a GreenLight campaign for Quest of Dungeons on Jan 16 and it got greenlit on Jan 21, votes were coming in like crazy, I did not see that coming. Some sites posted about the game, like TouchArcade and PocketGamer, which was also very cool. So right now I‚Äôm working like crazy to implement everything from steam onto the game (Mac/PC) but I still don‚Äôt have an exact launch date, although the iOS version is 90% certain to come out this February.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons development update
item.description: I‚Äôve been working on Quest of Dungeons and I‚Äôm nearing Gold. I‚Äôm attempting to release every version on the same day, which I never managed to do before but would like to do this time. I have both the iOS, Mac and Windows version very stable, the Mac and iOS apps were already accepted by the App Store, for Windows I‚Äôm still trying to wrap up the process of getting it on a digital store too.

item.title: A new game project and new job
item.description: Hey everyone! So a lot of things have happened since my last post. New project I‚Äôve been talking about this via twitter for the past few weeks but this is the first official post talking about it. In last 7 Days Rogue-like I had this desire to make another one, a faster, less feature oriented RL, just explore and kill. I didn‚Äôt made much of the prototype at that time, but in the past month I returned to it, worked a bit more intensively and decided to launch it to iOS.
